name: 42 Macro
title: The Macro Minute: Does DeepSeek Represent An End to US Exceptionalism?
text:
Synopsis
Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has demonstrated potentially disruptive AI capabilities by developing a high-performance model with minimal resources, challenging the US AI technological dominance and raising questions about future AI development and investment strategies.

Key Insights
- DeepSeek developed an AI model that outperformed Meta Llama 3.1, OpenAI ChatGPT 4, and Anthropic Claude 3.5 in accuracy tests for complex problem solving, math, and coding
- The model was built in only two months for $6 million, significantly less than the hundreds of billions spent by major hyperscalers
- DeepSeek successfully trained its model using cheaper H800 chips after being cut off from advanced Nvidia H100 chips due to US export restrictions
- The development suggests potential for more efficient AI model development and challenges the current US AI technological exceptionalism
- Potential market implications include potential discounting of US AI stocks and increased government intervention through subsidies and export controls
- The Trump administration is likely to pursue additional tariffs against China through a global trade and currency manipulation review, potentially as a revenue offset strategy
